alert.note: Alert for Cody Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued February 18 at 2:49PM MST until February 20 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM SATURDAY TO 5 AM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...West winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected. Localized wind gusts in excess of 70 mph possible on the west side of Clark near the foothills. * WHERE...Cody Foothills. The strongest winds are expected from the junction of Highway 120 and Chief Joseph Highway northward to the Clark area. A secondary high wind area is south of Cody near the Cody Landfill road. * WHEN...From 5 AM Saturday to 5 AM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Elevated blowover risk, especially for light and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Some locations will have relatively weak winds followed by a sudden, very strong wind gust. Please keep both hands on your steering wheel.
info.instruction: Use caution if you must drive. In a parking lot, park into the wind to minimize the possibility of your car door hitting another parked vehicle.
